title: christians mark good friday isolation
story: The chanting of a small group of clerics inside Jerusalemrsquos Church of the Holy Sepulchre echoed faintly through the heavy wooden doors, as a few people stopped and kneeled outside to pray.The centuries-old church, built on the site where Christians believe Jesus was crucied, buried and rose from the dead, is usually packed with pilgrims and tourists. vw,vw,px, px"A priest peers from a window in the door of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem Later, three monks in brown robes and blue surgical masks prayed at the stations of the cross along the Via Dolorosa, the ancient route through the Old City where Jesus is believed to have carried the cross before his execution at the hands of the Romans. It runs past dozens of shops, cafes, restaurants and hostels, nearly all of which are closed.In ordinary times, tens of thousands of pilgrims from around the world retrace Jesusrsquos steps in the Holy Week leading up to Easter. But this year, flights are grounded and religious sites in the Holy Land are closed as authorities try to prevent the spread of the virus.James Joseph, a Christian pilgrim from Detroit, dubbed ldquothe Jesus guy because he wears robes and goes about barefoot, lives near the Church of the Holy Sepulchre year-round. On Friday morning he had the plaza outside to himself.He said Good Friday has special meaning this year: ldquoThe crucixion is the saddest thing possible, andfelt what we feel right now, he said. ldquoBut thanks be to God hellip He rose from the dead and changed the world on Easter. vw,vw,px, px"Pope Francis attends a Mass for Holy Thursday inside St Peterrsquos Basilica at the Vatican In Rome, the torch-lit Way of the Cross procession at the Colosseum is a highlight of Holy Week, drawing large crowds of pilgrims, tourists and locals. It has been cancelled this year, along with all other public gatherings in Italy, which is battling one of the worst outbreaks.The virus has killed more than , people in Italy and over , worldwide, according to data gathered by Johns Hopkins University.Instead of presiding over the Way of the Cross procession, Pope Francis will lead a Good Friday ceremony in St Peterrsquos Square without the public.Ten people ndash five from the Vaticanrsquos health office and five from a prison in Padua, in northern Italy, where infections are particularly widespread ndash will participate in the procession, which will circle several times around the obelisk in St Peterrsquos Square.On display in the square will be a wooden crucix, famed for being carried in a procession during the plague that ravaged Rome in the early th century. vw,vw,px, px"Notre Dame cathedral is holding a special Good Friday ceremony in the landmarkrsquos charred interior but it is closed to the public Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, nearly destroyed by fire a year ago, is holding a special Good Friday ceremony in the charred, gutted interior of the medieval landmark.But the event is closed to the public for two reasons: Francersquos strict virus confinement measures forbid religious or any other gatherings, and the cathedral remains too structurally unstable to let parishioners inside.ldquoWe wanted to send a message of hope through the ceremony, Paris Archbishop Michel Aupetit told reporters this week.ldquoThe message of hope is especially important for our compatriots at a time when we are particularly affected by the coronavirus, which is sowing anguish and death, he said. vw,vw,px, px"A crucix in front of the closed doors of St Peterrsquos parish church in Manila In the Philippines, Asiarsquos bastion of Catholicism, masses and other solemn gatherings have been put on hold, including folk rituals that feature real-le crucixions and usually draw thousands of tourists and penitents.The annual procession of the ldquoBlack Nazarene, a centuries-old statue of Jesus, through central Manila, has also been cancelled.Churchgoers have been told to stay home and remember Jesusrsquos suffering through family prayers, fasting and by watching masses and religious shows on TV or online.For Josille Sabsal, it is a test of faith. The -year-old Catholic missionary tried to replicate an altar in her home in the capital by setting up a laptop, a crucix and small statues of Jesus and the Virgin Mary on a table.ldquoItrsquos dferent, because the priest is on a screen, she said. ldquoWhen the internet lags, the mass suddenly gets cut off and you have to look for another YouTube video.ldquoI miss that moment in church when you say lsquoPeace be with yoursquo to complete strangers and they smile back.The Rev Flavie Villanueva, a former drug addict who ministers in Manilarsquos slums, got special permission to celebrate Mass on Thursday for  homeless people in a college basketball court. They wore masks, stayed more than an armrsquosapart, and there was no singing.He said he was sad to see the churches emptied out, but hopes it will help people to renew their faith.ldquoWe are asked to go back and rediscover where the church in our lives first started, and thatrsquos in the family..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagaga, title: Christians mark Good Friday in isolation article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log -- s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice.  st   Removed    to cater for wrap advert  Removed    to cater for wrap advertlastScrollTop  stPlease stay at homeReporter: Ciara MaguireEmail: ciara.maguire@strabaneweeklyThursday  April  :HEALTH Minister Robin Swann has pleaded with the general public to stay at home over the Easter holiday weekend. And he stressedthat those flouting public health advice have no right joining in the weekly applause for care workers. “Please don’t be tempted into letting down your guard over Easter. Our health and social care staff are relying on us all to keep doing the right thing. “The weekly Thursday night applause is so important and heartening, but it is not sufficient by itself. We have to keep following the social distancing restrictions. The vast majority of people are doing so, and I thank them for it. “But I am urging the small majority ignoring the restrictions to think again for the sake of themselves and their loved ones. Don’t be a hypocrite tonight by applauding care workers and then letting them down by your actions.” Mr Swann added: “The social distancing measures will stay in place for as long as they are needed and will be strengthened furtherrequired. “They are starting to make an impact.
